Proteins are like sentences

Last updated on April 11, 2021

Proteins are based on strings of amino acids which fold in non-linear ways. Mutations can alter the “meaning” of the sentence (i.e. the structure and function of the resulting protein). However, a level of redundancy renders some mutations neutral, just like context disambiguates words. Conversely, understanding a sentence might resemble a folding process in conceptual space.

Resources

  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Behave_(book)
